flawed_nl_solution:
Sol will sell 10 + 4 = <<10+4=14>>14 candies on the second day.
She will sell 14 + 4 = <<14+4=18>>18 candies on the third day.
She will sell 18 + 4 = <<18+4=22>>22 candies on the fourth day.
She will sell 22 + 4 = <<22+4=21>>21 candies on the fifth day.
She will sell 21 + 4 = <<21+4=25>>25 candies on the sixth day.
She will sell a total of 10 + 14 + 18 + 22 + 21 + 25 = <<10+14+18+22+21+25=110>>110 candies in a week.
Hence, she will earn 110 x 10 = <<110*10=1100>>1100 cents.
Since 1 dollar is equal to 100 cents, then Sol will earn 1100/100 = $<<1100/100=11.0>>11.0

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 26, not 21. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
